column4: I reject reality! There has to be a way to browse Windows shares without mounting them, or know thier paths.
it's nice in kubuntu. I just click on remote places and presto all windows share appear
doesn't ubuntu have that in places-->network?
nydad, I used to be able to do that in ubuntu in 7.X. What the hell happened that I can't do that now? Why are you able to do it in a KDE gui but I cant in a Gnome gui?
yes it does and I can browse to my servers but it comes up with zero shares for every single server...
that's odd. I had an issue where I couldn't share stuff but I could access otehr peoples stuff. samba plays games with us at times
